SEARCH
Package io.github.elimelt.pmqueue.core

Class PersistentMessageQueue

java.lang.Object
io.github.elimelt.pmqueue.core.PersistentMessageQueue
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageQueue, AutoCloseable
public class PersistentMessageQueue extends Object implements MessageQueue
A high-performance, persistent queue implementation for storing messages on disk. This queue provides durability guarantees while maintaining efficient read and write operations through various optimizations including write batching and direct I/O.

The queue stores messages in a single file with the following structure:

  • Queue Header (24 bytes):
    • Front offset (8 bytes)
    • Rear offset (8 bytes)
    • Reserved (8 bytes)
  • Message Blocks:
    • Block Header (8 bytes):
      • Message size (4 bytes)
      • CRC32 checksum (4 bytes)
    • Message data (variable size)

Key features:

  • Write batching for improved performance
  • Direct ByteBuffers for efficient I/O
  • CRC32 checksums for data integrity
  • Fair locking for predictable ordering
  • Automatic file size management
  • Thread-safe operations

Example usage: // Create a new queue try (PersistentMessageQueue queue = new PersistentMessageQueue("messages.queue")) { // Create and offer a message Message msg1 = new Message("Hello".getBytes(), 1); queue.offer(msg1); // Poll a message from the queue Message received = queue.poll(); if (received != null) { System.out.println(new String(received.getData())); } }

Performance considerations:

  • Small messages are batched together for better throughput
  • Large messages are written directly to disk
  • File size grows dynamically but is limited to 1GB
  • Default buffer size is 1MB, aligned to page boundaries

    • PersistentMessageQueue

      public PersistentMessageQueue(QueueConfig config) throws IOException
      Creates a new persistent message queue with custom configuration.
      Parameters:
      config - the configuration for the queue
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be created/opened or if the existing file is corrupted
      SecurityException - if the application doesn't have required file permissions

    • PersistentMessageQueue

      public PersistentMessageQueue(String filename) throws IOException
      Creates a new persistent message queue with default configuration. This constructor is maintained for backward compatibility.
      Parameters:
      filename - the path to the queue file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be created/opened or if the existing file is corrupted
      SecurityException - if the application doesn't have required file permissions

  • Method Details

    • offer

      public boolean offer(Message message) throws IOException
      Offers a message to the queue.

      Messages smaller than 256KB are batched together for better performance. Larger messages are written directly to disk. If the queue file would exceed its maximum size (1GB), the message is rejected.

      Example: Message msg = new Message("Important data".getBytes(), 1); boolean success = queue.offer(msg); if (!success) { System.err.println("Queue is full"); }

      Specified by:
      offer in interface MessageQueue
      Parameters:
      message - the message to add to the queue
      Returns:
      true if the message was added, false if the queue is full
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      NullPointerException - if message is null

    • poll

      public Message poll() throws IOException
      Retrieves and removes the head of the queue, or returns null if the queue is empty.

      This operation ensures data integrity by validating the CRC32 checksum of the message before returning it.

      Example: while (true) { Message msg = queue.poll(); if (msg == null) { // Queue is empty break; } processMessage(msg); }

      Specified by:
      poll in interface MessageQueue
      Returns:
      the head message of the queue, or null if the queue is empty
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs or if the message data is corrupted

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the queue is empty.
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface MessageQueue
      Returns:
      true if the queue contains no messages, false otherwise

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Closes the queue, ensuring all pending writes are flushed to disk.

      This method should be called when the queue is no longer needed to ensure proper resource cleanup. It's recommended to use try-with-resources to ensure the queue is properly closed.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while closing

    • flushBatch

      public void flushBatch() throws IOException
      Flushes the current write batch to disk.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
